This page is set up as a container for database searches. Select [Insert] in menu (gear icon or context menu in tree on the left) to add text elements and widgets: search, results list and visualisation (map, timeline, network diagram, report etc.).

record.title: webpage: The database
record.detail:
[{"name":"Page","type":"group","children":[{"name":"Default Text","type":"text","content":"

Please retain this page in your website

This page is a placeholder - flesh out as needed.
Please tell visitors how Heurist has helped this project so that they are encouraged to try it. Otherwise the infrastructure goes unnoticed.
By all means reorganise the page's position, but please give it some prominence.

By helping grow the user base you help guarantee Heurist's healthy future, for you and for everyone (including the reader).

-------------------------------------------

History of development

This website is built from, and in, a Heurist database (see information below).

** Please describe the creation of the database and the website, acknowledging the Heurist team members individually for their help and for any work done on either component, as appropriate **

About Heurist

Heurist is a free, flexible, open-source (on gitHub) data management application and website builder specifically designed for researchers in the Humanities. It has been developed at the University of Sydney since 2005 under the direction of Dr Ian Johnson, and has been informed by the needs of hundreds of research projects.

Heurist is available as free, non-commercial web services available to researchers worldwide. Please visit HeuristNetwork.org to find a service in your region.

Heurist allows researchers to design, build, analyse, visualise, publish (via the web) and archive their own databases without coding or technical support, including the automatic generation of a 'vanilla' website which can be used as-is or customised extensively to fit a specific graphic design. Websites are edited through the Heurist website editor, stored as an integral part of the database and generated directly by the Heurist software. This allows for reliability and sustainability, and for optimal interaction with the data including images, and the use of Heurist's interface components (widgets such as facet searches, result lists, maps, timelines, custom reports and network diagrams) directly in the website.

The development team provides support to all Heurist users, including free email support and bug fixing for unfunded projects and consultancy services for database modelling, database construction, conversion of existing databases and websites, code development, website construction and training. Heurist is entirely non-profit; consultancy work provides the funding required to run the project.

","dom_id":"cms-content-18","css":{}}],"folder":true,"dom_id":"cms-content-17","css":{}}]

record.detail:
UNCONFIGURED TITLE
Use website editor to set title

fr: TITRE NON-CONFIGURÉ
Utiliser Website Editor pour configurer

Enter a concise description of the Heurist database / website here, which will be used eg. in lists of websites and in search engine discovery.
Remember to indicate the institution and/or project, target audience and nature of the content.

[{"name":"Page","type":"group","children":[{"name":"Content","type":"text","css":{},"content":"

This is default content generated by the Heurist CMS function. Please edit the web pages in this site to create appropriate content.

The pages may embed images and dynamic components such as facet searches, maps, network diagrams and reports using buttons at the end of the toolbar (when viewed in the website editor).

Please visit The database to read more about Heurist, or visit the Heurist Project website or Heurist Help pages for further information.

If you come across this page with default content (these instructions), please email the website owner

(link below) and ask them to update or delete the page.

","dom_id":"cms-content-16"}],"folder":true,"dom_id":"cms-content-15","css":{}}]
Digital Humanities, Heurist, Research, Database, Open Data
